summary: Core bridge crashes with a panic when given invalid TLS certificate options instead of throwing an informative error. This affects JavaScript users who bypass TypeScript's type protection.
userImpact: Users passing invalid TLS certificate options experience a cryptic internal crash instead of a clear error message, especially JavaScript users without TypeScript protection.
rootCause: Core bridge calls `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value in conversions.rs:108 when receiving invalid certificate pair data.
resolutionDetails: Resolved by improving input validation and error handling in the core bridge to provide informative errors instead of panics.
keyQuote: called `Option::unwrap()` on a `None` value - should provide good JS support with informative error messages
